MCQs.question: What event triggered the unchecked growth of government spending in Chapter 10?
options: a) The governmentâ€™s decision to balance the budget
b) The ability of senators to issue unlimited Fish Reserve Notes
c) Increased taxes
d) The reduction of government programs
MCQs.answer: b) The ability of senators to issue unlimited Fish Reserve Notes.

MCQs.question: What is the primary cause of inflation in Chapter 10?
options: a) Increase in demand
b) Government spending
c) Excess money supply without corresponding goods and services
d) High production costs
MCQs.answer: c) Excess money supply without corresponding goods and services.

MCQs.question: Which real-life event is used as an example of government over-spending and inflation?
options: a) The 2008 financial crisis in the U.S.
b) The 1980s oil crisis
c) The Industrial Revolution
d) The 2020 COVID-19 pandemic
MCQs.answer: a) The 2008 financial crisis in the U.S.

MCQs.question: What was the purpose of the Clean Rocks Jobs Program?
options: a) To improve the infrastructure
b) To create jobs by cleaning rocks
c) To build a new navy
d) To fund scientific research
MCQs.answer: b) To create jobs by cleaning rocks.

MCQs.question: What effect did fishflation have on savings in Chapter 10?
options: a) It increased the value of savings
b) It led to the loss of value in savings
c) It did not affect savings
d) It encouraged long-term investment
MCQs.answer: b) It led to the loss of value in savings.
